tweet: Women’s rights are human rights. 2 years ago, the #WomensMarch made that message loud and clear for the Administration and the world to hear. The movement continues. I’m proud to support the fight in congress for fair wages, health care access and gender equality for all women.

In 2018, these gains stalled for the first time when the uninsured rate rose. Every American deserves access to care, regardless of their racial or ethnic background. Attacks on health care threaten to leave minority groups behind. This is why we must fight to #ProtectOurCare

Addressing minority health issues and eliminating health disparities must be a priority. The #ACA narrowed gaps in outcomes by expanding access to life-saving treatment to vulnerable citizens. https://www.commonwealthfund.org/publications/2020/jan/how-ACA-narrowed-racial-ethnic-disparities-access …

I took an oath today to serve as an impartial juror and conduct a fair trial in the Senate. I take this oath and constitutional responsibility seriously, which is why I hope we can proceed with the evidence we need – the relevant documents & witnesses – to reach a just conclusion

I’m especially pleased with the USMCA’s anti-corruption and good governance provisions, which enforce accountability and transparency, signaling to our trading partners and the rest of the world that our principles are as valuable as our goods. pic.twitter.com/I0dnFZ63kS

More imports & exports = more jobs & opportunities for Marylanders. We worked behind the scenes to add provisions to the USMCA to help our small business owners and farmers compete in the global market. The USMCA is good for our environment, for workers & it’s good for Maryland.

.@POTUS violated the War Powers Act in 3 ways: There was no imminent threat, no consultation with Congress before the attack, and no submission of an authorization of military action.

The DOJ opinion that states can no longer ratify the #ERA is wrong. Congress can set & change deadlines to ratify constitutional amendments – it’s happened before & that’s exactly what SJ Res 6 would do.
